paper_metadata.title: Ocular Involvement in Hereditary Transthyretin Amyloidosis: A Case Series Describing Novel Potential Biomarkers
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data for affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Aged between 51 and 87, 6 males and 3 females
patients.phenotype: Hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis (hATTR) with ocular involvement

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The only examined carrier reported sensory symptoms in lower limbs but neurophysiological investigations were unremarkable.
The only examined carrier reported sensory symptoms in lower limbs but neurophysiological investigations were unremarkable.
The only examined carrier reported sensory symptoms in lower limbs but neurophysiological investigations were unremarkable.

functional_data.summary: The study evaluated ocular findings in patients with hATTR, revealing significant abnormalities in ERG.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, as indicated by the presence of affected siblings.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical presentation and genetic testing.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the presence of ocular manifestations in hATTR patients.
key_quotes: In all patients, corneal nerve plexa examined with CCM were poorly represented or absent.
The only examined carrier reported sensory symptoms in lower limbs but neurophysiological investigations were unremarkable.
